page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: {UPHALL FARM,LITTLE CARLTON Uphall Farm is one of a group of 12 local farms managed by a large international company.It is an arable farm of 250 acres growing rape,wheat, barley,lupins and Brussel sprouts.The soil is a sandy loam overlying a heavy clay.Some of the crops need chemical fertilisers twice yearly to produce a high yield.A 4 or 5 year rotation of crops is practised.The sequence being rape or Brussel sprouts followed by 1, 2 or 3 crops of wheat then winter barley.Lupins are a new crop being grown commercially for oil and the residue for animal food.The farm also has trial plots of wheat and some 'Mission'wheat produced here is specially grown for its seed.The implements are 25 tractors,3 combine- harvesters,4 drills amongst others.
